p: Hierarchical cluster analysis of C. aromatica essential oils clearly identified three clusters based on dissimilarity ( Figure 2). Cluster 1 had a relatively high camphor concentration, represented by the C. aromatica EO sample from Thailand [ 38]; cluster 2 was dominated by curdione followed by 1,8-cineole, represented by two samples from Japan [ 37]; and cluster 3 represents samples with large concentrations of ar-curcumene and Î²-curcumene [ 15, 37, 39, 40, 41, 42]. Table 7 summarizes the cluster centroids of the major components of C. aromatica rhizome oils.
